Type-3, 0.9mm, 10L, Mainstream, Premium Mid Loss (PML), For MOP

Pcb Type: Type-3

Pcb Thickness: 0.9mm

Pcb Layer Count: 10

Category: Mainstream

Material: Premium Mid Loss (PML)

Variant: For MOP

Type-3, 0.9mm, 10L, Mainstream, Premium Mid Loss (PML), For MOP
Routing LayerDescriptionTline TypeDescription MemoryTline Type MemoryThickness (um)EDWDielectric ConstantLoss Tangent
S/MNoneS/MNone1340.031
1BO, PowerMSBO, PowerMS309.6
PPNonePPNone603.30.009
2GNDGND/PowerGNDGND/Power30
CORENoneCORENone643.70.009
3BO, Main Route, PowerSLBO, Main RouteSL309.6
PPNonePPNone643.30.009
4GND, PowerGND/PowerGNDGND/Power309.6
CORENoneCORENone643.70.009
5Main Route, PowerDSLBO, Main RouteSL309.6
PPNonePPNone643.30.009
6Main Route, PowerDSLGNDGND/Power309.6
CORENoneCORENone643.70.009
7GNDGND/PowerMain Route, PowerSL309.6
PPNonePPNone643.30.009
8BO, Main Route, PowerSLGNDGND/Power309.6
CORENoneCORENone643.70.009
9GNDGND/PowerGND, PowerGND/Power309.6
PPNonePPNone603.30.009
10GND, Power, Main RouteMSGND, PowerGND/Power309.6
S/MNoneS/MNone1340.031
Notes
Note
Dielectric thickness of 64um has been chosen specifically on SL layers to ensure POR memory speeds are met. Customers following thicker dielectrics will need to ensure cross talk co-efficient are equal to or less than those specified in memory Tline spec.

M*DSL5, 6CPU PCIe Gen 510012050050080-0.710.0130.013
M*DSL5, 6CPU USB 3.2 Gen 1, CPU USB 3.2 Gen 2, PCH USB 3.2 Gen 1, PCH USB 3.2 Gen 2, TCP TBT4, TCP TBT510012045050080-0.710.0240.013
Type-3, 0.9mm, 10L, Mainstream, Premium Mid Loss (PML) Tline Spec (Differential) Notes
Note
Routing Notes for CSI CPHY: (1) CPHY must be routed as a trio (2) If the port is supposed to support both CPHY and DPHY, it must be routed following CPHY guidelines (3) CPHY impedance target is 40 ohms single ended and 80 ohms differential (4) All traces in trio must follow same trace width (5) Intra-Pair guidelines must be used for trace to trace spacing in a trio (6) S-ES guidelines must be used for trio to trio in the same port (7) S-Non-ES must be used for port to port or CPHY to other interface (8) CSI CPHY in Microstrip (MS) routing is not recommended for long length, allowed only for short length (<5 mm) near the connector.
For CNVio3 signal spacing: CNVio3 to non-CNVio3 pair spacing of 10H (H=Dielectric Thickness) is required. If this cannot be achieved, then GND shielding with proper stitching vias and 3H minimum spacing from GND shielding to CNVio3 is required. Please also refer to "CNVio3 Spacing Recommendation" diagram in CNVio3 section.

Type-3, 0.9mm, 10L, Mainstream, Premium Mid Loss (PML) Tline Spec (Single Ended) Notes
Note
1) Based on Tline Spec (Single Ended) table recommendation, the CLK - Any (um) spacing requirement shall be applicable for: a) CLK to DATA signals on similar signaling group. b) CLK to DATA signals from other signaling group. c) CLK to CLK signals from other signaling group. 2) For CLK to pseudo static signals, the spacing between the CLK to others can be relaxed and used the DATA - Any (um) spacing requirement. Example of pseudo static signal: RESET, ALERT, Chip Select (CS), Request (REQ), INTERRUPT, INIT. 3) CPU Sideband IO refers to CATERR#, EPD_ON, FORCEPR#, THERMTRIP#, VDD2PWRGOOD signals.

CNVio3

Description: Serial Time Encoded Protocol (STEP) is a non-NRZ, non-PAM signaling architecture, which is referred to as CNVio3 in product design guidelines. CNVio3 (STEP) uses pulse width modulation and operates at a lower fundamental frequency than NRZ for similar data rates. It is a DC coupled asynchronous bus having high bandwidth, low power and small exit latency from low power states. The current version of CNVio3 has a data transfer rate of 12 Gbps to support the Intel WiFi7 integrated solution. Reflections and crosstalk are the primary performance limiters and hence CNVio3 requires a very clean channels.

CNVio3 Breakout and Break-in Guideline
Module Down Pad Dimension and Voiding Requirements
M.2 Connector Pad Voiding Recommendation
Void Above and Below Buried Vias PTH Pads in Type-4 Stackup
CNVio3 Spacing Recommendation
CNVio3 General Guidelines
NoteDetail
Length matching between P and N within a diff. pairWithin same layer mismatch: 0.178 mm Total length mismatch: 0.127 mm
Single ended equivalent impedance of differential channelFor a differential channel transmission line impedance of 80 Ω, the equivalent required single ended transmission line impedance should be 40 Ω.
Voiding recommendation for mainstream stackupIt is recommended to void reference plane for all component pads such as M.2 Connector pads/Module pads to optimize the impedance matching in the channel. Recommended voiding depth: - For M.2 connector pads: >= 230 um to the closest ground reference layer. - For module pads: >= 150 um to the closet ground reference layer.
Number of vias allowed Max 2 vias.
Max via stub length for Type 3 PTH ViasMax PTH via stub length is 0.215 mm.
Reference planeContinuous GND is required on both sides.
FiberweaveMust adhere to fiberweave related best routing practices (#406926).
CNVio3 BO/BI routing guideCNVio3 BO/BI at the device requires the same impedance as main route. No neckdown into pin field. Refer to “CNVio3 BO/BI at Device Guideline” for more details.
Module pad dimensionModule pad dimension is 0.4 mm x 0.6 mm. Refer to the “Module Down Pad Dimension and Voiding Requirements” diagram.
Essential guidelines for routing near switch mode power supply, routing under inductor, routing under phase node, and routing under DrMOSDo not route CNVio3 traces on any layer of the PCB under phase nodes, Inductor and DrMOS.
Differential Via optimizationDifferential Impedance of a via should be centered around the characteristic impedance of the channel (±10 Ω tolerance) for Optimum performance.
Maximum via stub for Type 4 Buried PTH Via0.085 mm
Voiding for Type4 buried PTH viasNeed to provide void above and below buried via's PTH pads. Voids need to be 75 um more in radius than pad radius. Void is required as shapes over big pads cause a capacitive dip in impedance which results in lower margins. Please refer to the image provided as a reference.
RCOMP for CNVio3CNV_RCOMP need to connect to external resistor (200 Ω 1%)
Signal name/ listCNV_HSIF_TX_P, CNV_HSIF_TX_N, CNV_HSIF_RX_P, CNV_HSIF_RX_N
CNVio3 Length Matching
Matching Group IdMatching GroupsTotal/Within LayerLength/DelayRequiredMaximum Mismatch
1Pair (P-N)TotalLength (mm)Yes0.127
2Pair (P-N)WithinLength (mm)Yes0.178

CNVio3 M.2 Topology

Ground Plane Voiding Under M.2 Connector Pads
M.2 Connector Pin Assignment
CNVio3 M.2 Topology Notes
NoteDetail
M.2 Connector Pin 18Pin 18 of the M.2 connector must be grounded on the motherboard side to prevent common mode coupling from the BRI signal onto CNVio3 signals, possibly resulting in functional failure of the CNVio3 bus.
Maximum Via stub allowed for Type-3 PTH Via215 um
Maximum via stub allowed for Type-4 Buried PTH via85 um. Via optimization is needed for higher via stub.
Signal name/ listCNV_WR_CLK_DN, CNV_WR_CLK_DP, CNV_WT_CLK_DN, CNV_WT_CLK_DP

CSI CPHY

CSI CPHY Cable Guidelines
CSI CPHY General Guidelines
NoteDetail
CPHY configuration routing recommendation Recommend each CPHY port to be routed on the same layer.
Common mode choke (CMC)Need is platform/ sensor specific and should be located near sensor. CMC not accounted for in PDG.
Trio length matching125 um for each trio; 1 mm between trios of a port.
Trio routing arrangementAll trios should be routed as A-B-C or C-B-A.
Referencing considerationNo routing over split planes allowed, or routing over noisy power planes. Only routing over solid planes are permissible. MIPI CSI CPHY signals should be treated as single ended nets.
Via placementVia placement must be uniform within a trio to enable unform routing and transition. During each via transition, it is imperative that return vias are placed symmetrically close to the data vias. Ensure minimal routing imbalances when traces are routed in/out from the via to reduce impedance imbalance i.e uniformity of spacing between wire A,B and C.
CSI port use preferenceIf some of the CSI ports are not used, it must have CSI_A as one of the used ports.
Loss numbers 1. PCB Loss number assumed: -0.42 dB/inch (worst case) at 1.25 GHz. 2. FPC cable loss number assumed: -0.316 dB/inch (worst case) at 1.25 GHz. 3. Cable length guideline is based on FPC cable. FPC cable loss should be within the loss number specified above. If micro-Coax is used, cable length can be longer as micro-Coax loss, for example 40 AWG cable has a loss of -0.15 dB/inch at 1.25 GHz. Please note that Cable loss numbers are general guidelines and actual numbers may be different due to the dimensions, type of material used. (Refer to the individual topologies for total loss numbers). These loss number take precedence over length mentioned in individual topologies below specially while using lower loss cable options like micro coaxial cables.
General Guidelines
NoteDetail
Cable assembly impedance50 ohms +/- 10% for single ended
Cable assembly Insertion Loss> -0.72 dB/inch; single ended; up to 1.25 Ghz
Cable assembly Return Loss< -28 dB total; single ended; up to 1.25 Ghz
Cable assembly Near end Crosstalk< -25 dB total; single ended; up to 1.25 Ghz
Cable assembly Far end Crosstalk< -26 dB total; single ended; up to 1.25 Ghz
Cable only impedance50 ohms +/- 10% for single ended
Cable only Insertion Loss> -0.041 dB/inch; single ended; up to 1.25 Ghz
Cable only Return Loss< -50 dB total; single ended; up to 1.25 Ghz
Cable only Near end Crosstalk< -55 dB total; single ended; up to 1.25 Ghz
Cable only Far end Crosstalk< -63 dB total; single ended; up to 1.25 Ghz

1Pair (P-N)TotalLength (mm)No

3TX-TXTotalLength (mm)No

5TX-RXTotalLength (mm)No

CSI CPHY Main Link Up To 1.0 Gsps Topology Notes
NoteDetail
Number of vias allowedMax 2 vias.
Reference plane for microstrip routeContinuous ground or continuous power that has low frequency peak to peak noise, ground preferred.
Reference plane for stripline routeBoth sides can either be continuous ground or continuous power that has low frequency peak to peak noise, ground preferred.
Total insertion loss (BO1+M1+M2+Internal Cable)For ≤ 1.0 Gsps: up to -10 dB @1.25 GHz.
Supported stackupsCSI CPHY is supported only on 10L T3 and 10L T4 stackups

CSI DPHY

CSI DPHY General Guidelines
NoteDetail
DPHY configuration routing recommendation Recommend each DPHY configuration (example: X4) to be routed on the same layer.
CSI_RCOMP200 Ω +/- 1% pull down to VSS. Provide good noise isolation. Platform Rdc < 0.1 Ω, board capacitance <1.5 pF.
Common mode choke (CMC)Need is platform/ sensor specific and should be located near sensor.
Port connectivityIt is recommended that CSI A be one of the used ports if all ports are not used.
Loss numbers1. PCB Loss number assumed: -0.36dB/inch (worst case) at 1.25 GHz 2. FPC cable loss number assumed: -0.316dB/inch (worst case) at 1.25 GHz 3. Cable length guideline is based on FPC cable. FPC cable loss should be within the loss number specified above. If micro-Coax is used, cable length can be longer as micro-Coax loss. Ex. 40 AWG cable has loss: -0.15dB/inch at 1.25 GHz. Please note that Cable loss numbers are general guidelines and actual numbers may be different due to the dimensions, type of material used. (Refer to the individual topologies for total loss numbers). These loss number take precedence over length mentioned in individual topologies below specially while using lower loss cable options like micro coaxial cables.
CSI DPHY Length Matching
Matching Group IdMatching GroupsTotal/Within LayerLength/DelayRequiredMaximum Mismatch
1Pair (P-N)TotalLength (mm)Yes0.125
2Pair (P-N)WithinLength (mm)Yes0.25
6DATA-CLKTotalLength (mm)Yes1

Reference plane for microstrip routeContinuous ground or continuous power that has low frequency peak to peak noise, ground preferred.
Reference plane for stripline and dual stripline routeBoth sides can either be continuous ground or continuous power that has low frequency peak to peak noise, ground preferred.
510 mm cable assemblyRecommend 100 Ω +/- 10% including tolerances. Return loss < -15 dB @ ≤ 1.25 GHz. Crosstalk < -50 dB @ ≤ 1.25 GHz.
Total insertion loss (BO+M1+M2+Internal Cable)For ≤ 1.0 Gbps: up to -10 dB @1.25 GHz.

Signal Group: Rx

Signal MRTS
Segment NameCategoryStartEnd
RXDevice01
BOTrace12
VIA1Via23
M1Trace34
VIA2Via45
M2Trace56
CABLECable6-1

SegmentTline TypeMax Length Segment (mm)

CSI DPHY Main Link Up To 2.0 Gbps Topology

CSI DPHY Main Link Up To 2.0 Gbps Topology Diagram
CSI DPHY Main Link Up To 2.0 Gbps Topology Notes
NoteDetail
Reference plane for microstrip routeContinuous ground or continuous power that has low frequency peak to peak noise, ground preferred.
Reference plane for stripline and dual stripline routeBoth sides can either be continuous ground or continuous power that has low frequency peak to peak noise, ground preferred.
305 mm cable assemblyRecommend 100 Ω +/- 10% including tolerances. Return loss < -15 dB @ ≤ 1.25 GHz. Crosstalk < -50 dB @ ≤ 1.25 GHz.
Total insertion loss (BO+M1+M2+Internal Cable)For ≤ 2.0 Gbps: up to -7 dB @ 1.25 GHz.

Signal GroupMax Number of Vias AllowedVia Placement
Rx2Total Channel

CPU PCIe Gen 1-3

Type-4 PCB Via Stitching Recommendation
Recommended GND Stitching Via Placement
PCIE Board Layout Recommendation Toe Side HSIO Routing
PCIE Board Layout Recommendation SMT footprint Voiding Reference
PCIE Board Layout Recommendation AC Cap Voiding
PCIE4 M.2 Connector Voiding Recommendation
PCIE4 M.2 Connector Toe and Heel GND Via Recommendation
CPU PCIe Gen 1-3 General Guidelines
NoteDetail
Reference plane(1) Continuous GND is recommended. (2) If continuous GND cannot be implemented, a combination of GND on one side and continuous power plane on the other side with the condition that the GND plane be the closer reference (dual-reference) can be implemented. The continuous power plane requires low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt). (3) If non-continuous power referencing is unavoidable on microstrip/ surface layer, signal can reference over power planes with a low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt), but stitching caps are required over each plane split and need to be placed within 6 mm of a signal running across the plane split.
Voiding recommendation for mainstream stackupIt is recommended to void unused (non-functional) pads for differential vias and pin pads for ESDs, AC caps and connectors to optimize the impedance matching in the channel.
PCIe1, PCIe2, PCIe3 discrete component part size for mainstream stackupIt is recommended to use 0402 or smaller component sizes.
Unused signalsUnused data signals should be left as no connect at the ball.
Interleave requirementRefer to topology section for details.
PCIe1, PCIe2, PCIe3 max via stub length< 900 um
Routing and return via requirement near vertical transitionFor all vertical transitions, the differential transmission line should be connected to the two vias symmetrically. Moreover, Vss return vias should be placed near the signal vias in an equidistant symmetrical manner, and all signal vias should have identical Vss return vias around each of them.
PTH connector voiding requirementDifferential Oval Anti Pad required for all layers.
Voiding under CEM SMT connector padsRequired
General Guidelines
NoteDetail
0 Ohm resistor for PCIe1, PCIe2, PCIe30402 or smaller size . Component pads reference plane needs to be voided.
PCIe1, PCIe2, PCIe3 discrete component part size for thin stackupIt is required to use 0201.
Voiding recommendation for thin stackupIt is required to void unused (non-functional) pads reference plane for differential vias and pin pads for ESDs, AC caps and connectors to optimize the impedance matching in the channel.
CPU PCIe Gen 1-3 Length Matching
Matching Group IdMatching GroupsTotal/Within LayerLength/DelayRequiredMaximum Mismatch
1Pair (P-N)TotalLength (mm)Yes0.125
2Pair (P-N)WithinLength (mm)Yes0.25
3TX-TXTotalLength (mm)No0
4RX-RXTotalLength (mm)No0
5TX-RXTotalLength (mm)No0
6DATA-CLKTotalLength (mm)No0

PCIe Gen 1 Device Down Topology

PCIe Gen 1 Device Down Topology Diagram
PCIe Gen 1 Device Down Topology Notes
NoteDetail
AC capacitor valueGen1: 75 nF - 265 nF Gen1 nominal = 100 nF
Breakout length and spacingAn initial breakout segment of 4 mm in length with a tighter pair-to-pair spacing of 0.11 mm - 0.16 mm is allowed. The maximum total breakout length is still 15.2 mm.
Routing type for mainstream stackupPrefer non-interleaved routes in different layers.
Max Number of vias
Signal GroupMax Number of Vias AllowedVia PlacementNotes
Rx, Tx6Total ChannelGen1 (not counting microvia under package)

M3Trace56

PCIe Gen 1 Internal Cable Topology

PCIe Gen 1 Internal Cable Topology Diagram
PCIe Gen 1 Internal Cable Topology Notes
NoteDetail
Add-in-card (M4 + M5)The total length of the add-in card (M4 + M5) is usually 38 mm to 50.4 mm. The M4 + M5 segment is a combination of MS/ SL/ DSL (MS where required to connect to surface mounted components). The M4 + M5 segment has a typical via count of 1.
AC capacitor valueGen1: 75 nF - 265 nF Gen1 nominal = 100 nF
Cable loss vs channel length trade-off tableSee PCIe with internal cable routing length versus cable loss figure.
Breakout length and spacingAn initial breakout segment of 4 mm in length with a tighter pair-to-pair spacing of 0.11 mm - 0.16 mm is allowed. The total breakout length is still 15.2 mm.
Clarification on M2 segment for RXThe M2 segment for RX can also be routed on SL or DSL and not limited to MS.
Routing type for mainstream stackupPrefer non-interleaved routes in different layers.
Max Number of vias
Signal GroupMax Number of Vias AllowedVia PlacementNotes
Tx2Total ChannelGen1 (not counting microvia under package).
Rx1Total ChannelGen1 (not counting microvia under package).

Routing type for mainstream stackupPrefer non-interleaved routes in different layers.

CPU PCIe Gen 4

Type-4 PCB Via Stitching Recommendation
Recommended GND Stitching Via Placement
PCIE Board Layout Recommendation SMT footprint Voiding Reference
PCIE Board Layout Recommendation AC Cap Voiding
PCIE4 M.2 Connector Voiding Recommendation
PCIE4 M.2 Connector Toe and Heel GND Via Recommendation
PCIE Board Layout Recommendation Toe Side HSIO Routing
CPU PCIe Gen 4 General Guidelines
NoteDetail
Reference plane(1) Continuous GND is recommended. (2) If continuous GND cannot be implemented, a combination of GND on one side and continuous power plane on the other side with the condition that the GND plane be the closer reference (dual-reference) can be implemented. The continuous power plane requires low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt). (3) If non-continuous power referencing is required on microstrip/ surface layer, signal can reference over power planes with a low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt), but stitching caps are required over each plane split and need to be placed within 6 mm of a signal running across the plane split.
Voiding recommendation for mainstream stackupIt is recommended to void unused (non-functional) pads reference plane for differential vias and pin pads for ESDs, AC caps and connectors to optimize the impedance matching in the channel.
PCIe4 AC capacitor size for mainstream stackupIt is required to use 0402. If routing near maximum length it is recommended to use 0201 component size.
Unused signalsUnused data signals should be left as no connect at the ball.
Interleaved requirementRefer to topology section for details.
PCIe4 max via stub length< 250 um
Via stub length relaxationPTH via stub length can be relaxed, refer to "MTL-UH PCIe Gen4 Stub Length Requirement Relaxation White Paper" #723631 for details.
Routing and return via requirement near vertical transitionFor all vertical transitions, the differential transmission line should be connected to the two vias symmetrically. Moreover, Vss return vias should be placed near the signal vias in an equidistant symmetrical manner, and all signal vias should have identical Vss return vias around each of them.
PTH connector voiding requirementDifferential Oval Anti Pad required for all layers. For PCIe4, see topology specific notes for additional guidance.
Voiding under CEM SMT connector padsRequired
Fiberweave for PCIe4Must adhere to fiberweave related best routing practices (#406926).
PCIe4 redriverRouting length can be extended beyond the PDG guidelines by using redriver. Refer to document #575423 for details.
General Guidelines
NoteDetail
0 Ohm resistor for PCIe1, PCIe2, PCIe30402 or smaller size . Component pads need to be voided.
PCIe1, PCIe2, PCIe3 discrete component part size for thin stackupIt is required to use 0201.
Voiding recommendation for thin stackupIt is required to void unused (non-functional) pads for differential vias and pin pads for ESDs, AC caps and connectors to optimize the impedance matching in the channel.
Backdrill for PCB PTHSignals can transition between any PCB layers as long as the maximum via / PTH stub length is < 250 um. Use backdrill to reduce stub length to meet < 250 um requirement.
CPU PCIe Gen 4 Length Matching
Matching Group IdMatching GroupsTotal/Within LayerLength/DelayRequiredMaximum Mismatch
1Pair (P-N)TotalLength (mm)Yes0.125
2Pair (P-N)WithinLength (mm)Yes0.25
3TX-TXTotalLength (mm)Yes25
4RX-RXTotalLength (mm)Yes25
5TX-RXTotalLength (mm)No0
6DATA-CLKTotalLength (mm)No0

PCIe Gen 4 Barlow Ridge Topology

PCIe Gen 4 Barlow Ridge Topology Diagram
PCIe Gen 4 Barlow Ridge Topology Notes
NoteDetail
Maximum via stub length for mainstream stackup250 um per via.
Reference plane for microstrip routeMust be continuous ground.
Reference plane for stripline routeOne side can be power plane that has low frequency peak-to-peak noise, the other side must be continuous ground. Prefer ground on both sides.
Reference plane for dual stripline routeOne side can be power plane that has low frequency peak-to-peak noise, the other side must be continuous ground and it is the layer that is closer to the signal route. Prefer ground on both sides.
AC cap valueNominal 220 nF recommended for Gen3 & Gen4 (spec range 75 nF to 265 nF including tolerance).
Routing type for mainstream stackupPrefer non-interleaved routes in different layers.
FiberweaveMust adhere to fiberweave related best routing practices (#406926).
Device / End Point package insertion lossDevice / End Point needs to be within the 3 dB specification as per the PCIe Base Spec Rev 4.0 Version 1.0.
Max Number of vias
Signal GroupMax Number of Vias AllowedVia Placement

Mainstream, Premium Mid Loss (PML), Rx,Tx

SegmentTline TypeMax Length Segment (mm)Max Length Segment Note

M1+M2+M3MS, DSL, SLMax length is BO+M1+M2+M3+M4 < 292 mm
M4MS12.7

Max Length Total (mm): 292

Max Length Total Note: Max length is BO+M1+M2+M3+M4 < 292 mm

PCIe Gen 4 Device Down Topology

PCIe Gen 4 Device Down Topology Diagram
PCIe Gen 4 Device Down Topology Notes
NoteDetail
Maximum via stub length for mainstream stackup250 um per via.
Reference plane for microstrip routeMust be continuous ground.
Reference plane for stripline routeOne side can be power plane that has low frequency peak-to-peak noise, the other side must be continuous ground. Prefer ground on both sides.
Reference plane for dual stripline routeOne side can be power plane that has low frequency peak-to-peak noise, the other side must be continuous ground and it is the layer that is closer to the signal route. Prefer ground on both sides.
AC cap valueNominal 220 nF recommended for Gen3 & Gen4 (spec range 75 nF to 265 nF including tolerance).
Routing type for mainstream stackupPrefer non-interleaved routes in different layers.
FiberweaveMust adhere to fiberweave related best routing practices (#406926).
Device / End Point package insertion lossDevice / End Point needs to be within the 3 dB specification as per the PCIe Base Spec Rev 4.0 Version 1.0.
Max Number of vias
Signal GroupMax Number of Vias AllowedVia Placement
Rx, Tx4Total Channel

PCIe Gen 4 M.2 Topology

PCIe Gen 4 M.2 Topology Diagram
PCIe Gen 4 M.2 Topology Notes
NoteDetail
Maximum via stub length for mainstream stackup250 um per via.
Reference plane for microstrip routeMust be continuous ground.
Reference plane for stripline routeOne side can be power plane that has low frequency peak-to-peak noise, the other side must be continuous ground. Prefer ground on both sides.
Reference plane for dual stripline routeOne side can be power plane that has low frequency peak-to-peak noise, the other side must be continuous ground and it is the layer that is closer to the signal route. Prefer ground on both sides.
AC cap valueNominal 220 nF recommended for Gen3 and Gen4 (spec range 75 nF to 265 nF including tolerance).
Routing type for mainstream stackupPrefer non-Interleaved routes in different layers.
M.2 connector Vss pad to via distanceEach M.2 connector Vss pad should be connected to its own Vss via. The distance between the edge of the pad and the edge of the via pad should be 0.5mm max.
Add-in cardAssuming ~50 mm of PCB routing and 2 vias with spec reference package. The total length matching RX-RX/TX-TX lane to lane (25mm max) include the budget within the module.
FiberweaveMust adhere to fiberweave related best routing practices (#406926).
Notes
NoteDetail
Backdrilled viaAllow for exit backdrill via of 250 um with 180 um entry stub.

Reference plane for microstrip routeMust be continuous ground.
Reference plane for stripline routeOne side can be power plane that has low frequency peak-to-peak noise, the other side must be continuous ground. Prefer ground on both sides.
Reference plane for dual stripline routeOne side can be power plane that has low frequency peak-to-peak noise, the other side must be continuous ground and it is the layer that is closer to the signal route. Prefer ground on both sides.
AC cap ValueNominal 220 nF recommended for Gen3/ 4 (spec range 75 nF to 265 nF including tolerance).
Routing type for mainstream stackupPrefer non-Interleaved routes in different layers.
CEM connector Vss pad to via distanceEach CEM connector Vss pad should be connected to its own Vss via. The distance between the edge of the pad and the edge of the via pad should be 0.5 mm max.
Add-in cardAssuming ~76 mm of PCB routing and 2 vias with spec reference package. The total length matching RX-RX/TX-TX lane to lane (25mm max) include the budget within the module.

CPU PCIe Gen 5

Board Layout Recommendation: PCIe Gen5 AC Cap Voiding
Void Above and Below Buried Vias PTH Pads in Type-4 Stackup
Voids Under SOC Ball Pads
CPU PCIe Gen 5 General Guidelines
NoteDetail
Voiding recommendationIt is recommended to void unused (non-functional) pads for differential vias and pin pads for ESDs, AC caps and connectors to optimize the impedance matching in the channel.
PCIe5 AC capacitor sizeIt is required to use 0201 . Void reference layer under pad size of differential cap together. Extend void by 50 um on all sides of pads. Reference example provided per figure. Ensure spacing between P and N cap is about ~305 um and spacing between caps of different pair caps is more than 762 um.
Unused signalsUnused data signals should be left as no connect at the ball.
Interleaved requirementPrefer non-interleaved routing. If Tx to Rx is routed same layer, need S-NES spacing as given in Tlinespec between Tx to Rx.
Routing and return via requirement near vertical transitionFor all vertical transitions, the differential transmission line should be connected to the two vias symmetrically. Moreover, Vss return vias should be placed near the signal vias in an equidistant symmetrical manner, and all signal vias should have identical Vss return vias around each of them.
Fiberweave for PCIe5Must adhere to fiberweave related best routing practices (#406926).
Antipad for Via800um diameter for anti-pad Via. Please refer to chapter "General Design Considerations", subheading "Differential Transitional Via Recommendations" for image illustrating anti-pad diameter. Bigger Anti-pad should be provided for T4 buried PTH also, follow pad size+175um radius say buried PTH pad size is 200um, anti-pad radius should be 375um (750um diameter).
Void under SOC ball padsSecond PCB layer should have void equal to pad size for T3 stackup PCB. And for T4 stackup with Via in pad, need to void around pad in top layer equal to 300 um radius size.
Void above and below buried via's PTH pads for T4 stackupNeed to provide void above and below buried via's PTH pads. Voids need to be 75 um more in radius than pad radius. Void is required as shapes over big pads cause a capacitive dip in impedance which results in lower margins. The same void should be provided in layers in which via is running through as well i.e., for PTH from L3 to L8, if there is no shape in L2 and L9 already (because of it being signal layer), nothing is required to be done for L2/L9. Void not required in L1/L10. Ensure no routing below these voids for other signals in L1 & L10.In case surface layers are power, ensure it is symmetric to both p and n. Refer to the image provided as a reference.
Reference plane for microstrip routeMust be continuous ground.
Reference plane for stripline routeGround on both sides strongly preferred. If necessary, only a single continuous power reference plane is permitted on one side, but the other side must be a continuous ground. Simulation is needed to ensure electrical requirements are met.
Reference plane for dual stripline routeGround on both sides strongly preferred. If necessary, only a single continuous power reference plane is permitted on one side, but the other side must be a continuous ground and it is the layer that is closer to the signal route. Simulation is needed to ensure electrical requirements are met.
General Guidelines
NoteDetail
0 ohm resistor for PCIe50201 or smaller size . Component pads need to be voided.
Backdrill for PCB PTHSignals can transition between any PCB layers as long as the maximum via / PTH stub length is < 250 um. Use backdrill to reduce stub length to meet < 250 um requirement.
CPU PCIe Gen 5 Length Matching
Matching Group IdMatching GroupsTotal/Within LayerLength/DelayRequiredMaximum Mismatch
1Pair (P-N)TotalLength (mm)Yes0.125
2Pair (P-N)WithinLength (mm)Yes0.125
3TX-TXTotalLength (mm)Yes25
4RX-RXTotalLength (mm)Yes25
5TX-RXTotalLength (mm)No0
6DATA-CLKTotalLength (mm)No0

PCIe Gen 5 M.2 Topology

PCIe Gen 5 M.2 Topology Diagram
Suggested Ground Void for Main Board M.2 Connector
Suggested Toe and Heel Side Connection
PCIe Gen 5 M.2 Topology Notes
NoteDetail
Maximum via stub length250 um per via.
AC cap valueNominal 220 nF recommended (spec range 75 nF to 265 nF including tolerance).
M.2 connectorEach M.2 connector Vss pad should be connected to its own Vss via on both side Toe and edge. The distance between the edge of the pad and the edge of the via pad should be 0.5 mm max.
Suggested Ground Void for Main Board Mdot2 connectorRefer to image above. Top layer (or layer in which connector is placed) avoid ground shapes 200 um away from signal pads. Void in Top layer should be bigger than void in L2 layer.
FiberweaveMust adhere to fiberweave related best routing practices (#406926).
Gen5 M.2 operating at Gen4Please refer to PCIe Gen4 M.2 Topology chapter for lengths.

PCIe Gen 5 Port Operating at Gen 4 Data Rate Device Down Topology

Description: Platform should avoid using the PCIe Gen 5 capable ports for Gen 4 device. Because even in Gen 4 speed, Gen 5 IP will use more power as compared Gen 4 IP both working at Gen 4 data rate.

PCIe Gen 5 Port Operating at Gen 4 Data Rate Device Down Topology Diagram

(Internal Validation) PCIe Gen 5 CEM Topology

PCIe Gen 5 CEM Topology Diagram
PCIe Board Layout Recommendation: CEM Connector Voiding
PCIe Board Layout Recommendation: Toe and Heel GND Via 1
PCIe Board Layout Recommendation: Toe and Heel GND Via 2
PCIe Board Layout Recommendation: Toe Side HSIO Routing
PCIe Board Layout Recommendation: SMT Footprint Voiding Reference
(Internal Validation) PCIe Gen 5 CEM Topology Notes
NoteDetail
Maximum via stub length250 um
AC cap valueNominal 220 nF recommended (spec range 176 nF to 265 nF including tolerance.). Use 0201 component size.
Add In Card Connector (CEM)Only SMT is supported.
FiberweaveMust adhere to fiberweave related best routing practices (#406926).
Voiding under CEM SMT connector padsRequired. The connector footprint solder pad width for PCIe Gen5 is 0.53 mm. The recommended void in reference plane extends 0.10 mm beyond the edges of the pads on three sides, with dimensions of 2.10 mm × 1.73 mm. Void should not extend from where signal is connected to pad. Attached imaged illustrate this. Please do signal connection only from "toe" side of SMT pad (the side where void is not extended). GND connection to SMT pads near main link should be less than 0.4 mm from SMT pad edge to via pad edge. Routing high speed signals to the "heel" side of the SMT pads introduces a significant capacitive/resonant stub that would seriously degrade channel performance.
Max Number of vias
Signal GroupMax Number of Vias AllowedVia Placement
Rx, Tx2Total Channel

Signal MRTS
Segment NameCategoryStartEnd

BOTrace12
M1Trace23
Via1Via34
M2Trace45
Via2Via56
CapCapacitor67
M3Trace78
CEM ConnectorDevice8-1

BOTrace12
M1Trace23
Via1Via34
M2Trace45
Via2Via56
M3Trace67
CEM ConnectorDevice7-1

PCH PCIe Gen 1-4

Recommended GND Stitching Via Placement
PCIE Board Layout Recommendation SMT footprint Voiding Reference
PCIE Board Layout Recommendation AC Cap Voiding
PCIE4 M.2 Connector Voiding Recommendation
PCIE4 M.2 Connector Toe and Heel GND Via Recommendation
PCIE Board Layout Recommendation Toe Side HSIO Routing
PCH PCIe Gen 1-4 General Guidelines
NoteDetail
Reference plane(1) Continuous GND is recommended. (2) If continuous GND cannot be implemented, a combination of GND on one side and continuous power plane on the other side with the condition that the GND plane be the closer reference (dual-reference) can be implemented. The continuous power plane requires low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt). (3) If non-continuous power referencing is unavoidable on microstrip/ surface layer, signal can reference over power planes with a low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt), but stitching caps are required over each plane split and need to be placed within 6 mm of a signal running across the plane split.
Voiding recommendation for mainstream stackupIt is recommended to void unused (non-functional) pads for differential vias and pin pads for ESDs, AC caps and connectors to optimize the impedance matching in the channel.
PCIe1, PCIe2, PCIe3 discrete component part size for mainstream stackupIt is recommended to use 0402 or smaller component sizes.
Unused signalsUnused data signals should be left as no connect at the ball.
Interleave requirementRefer to topology section for details.
PCIe1, PCIe2, PCIe3 max via stub length< 900 um
PCIe4 max via stub length< 250 um
Routing and return via requirement near vertical transitionFor all vertical transitions, the differential transmission line should be connected to the two vias symmetrically. Moreover, Vss return vias should be placed near the signal vias in an equidistant symmetrical manner, and all signal vias should have identical Vss return vias around each of them.
PTH connector voiding requirementDifferential Oval Anti Pad required for all layers.
Voiding under CEM SMT connector padsRequired
PCIe4 RedriverRouting length can be extended beyond the PDG guidelines by using redriver. Refer to document #575423 for further details.
Fiberweave for PCIe4Must adhere to fiberweave related best routing practices (#406926)
Recommendations and considerations for routing near switch mode power supply, routing under inductor, routing under phase node, and routing under DrMOSRefer to Technical White Paper Doc#:  726825
General Guidelines
NoteDetail
0 Ohm resistor for PCIe1, PCIe2, PCIe30402 or smaller size . Component pads reference plane needs to be voided.
Backdrill for PCB PTHSignals can transition between any PCB layers as long as the maximum via / PTH stub length is < 250 um. Use backdrill to reduce stub length to meet < 250 um requirement.
PCH PCIe Gen 1-4 Length Matching
Matching Group IdMatching GroupsTotal/Within LayerLength/DelayRequiredMaximum Mismatch
1Pair (P-N)TotalLength (mm)Yes0.125
2Pair (P-N)WithinLength (mm)Yes0.25
3TX-TXTotalLength (mm)Yes25
4RX-RXTotalLength (mm)Yes25
5TX-RXTotalLength (mm)No0
6DATA-CLKTotalLength (mm)No0

Clarification on M2 segment for RXThe M2 segment for RX can also be routed on SL or DSL and not limited to MS.
Routing type for mainstream stackupPrefer non-interleaved routes in different layers.

(Internal) PCIe Gen1 Add-in Card Topology

PCIe Gen1 Add-in Card Topology Diagram
(Internal) PCIe Gen1 Add-in Card Topology Notes
NoteDetail
Add-in card (M4 + M5)The total length of the add-in card (M4 + M5) is usually 38 mm to 50.4 mm. The M4 + M5 segment is a combination of MS/SL/DSL (MS where required to connect to surface mounted components). The M4 + M5 segment has a typical via count of 1.
Reference planecontinuous GND recommended. See Power Referencing tab for power referencing guidelines
Recommended AC capacitor value for PCIe Gen1Nominal 220 nF. (Spec range 176 nF to 265 nF including tolerance).
Max via stub length900 um
Routing type for mainstream stackupPrefer non-interleaved routes in different layers.
Max Number of vias
Signal GroupMax Number of Vias AllowedNotes
Rx, Tx4PCIe Gen1 Motherboard

Add-in card (M4 + M5)The total length of the add-in card (M4 + M5) is usually 38mm to 50.4mm. The M4 + M5 segment is a combination of MS/SL/DSL (MS where required to connect to surface mounted components). The M4 + M5 segment has a typical via count of 1.

PCIe Gen4 Device Down Topology

PCIe Gen4 Device Down Topology Diagram
PCIe Gen4 Device Down Topology Notes
NoteDetail
DevicePCIe Gen4 Spec compliant device.
AC cap valueRefer to Base Spec
Maximum via stub length for mainstream stackup250 um
Reference plane for microstrip routeMust be continuous ground.
Reference plane for stripline routeOne side can be power plane that has low frequency peak-to-peak noise, the other side must be continuous ground. Prefer ground on both sides.
Reference plane for dual stripline routeOne side can be power plane that has low frequency peak-to-peak noise, the other side must be continuous ground and it is the layer that is closer to the signal route. Prefer ground on both sides.
Routing type for mainstream stackupPrefer non-interleaved routes in different layers.
FiberweaveMust adhere to fiberweave related best routing practices (#406926).
Max Number of vias
Signal GroupMax Number of Vias AllowedNotes

PCIe Gen4 M.2 Topology

PCIe Gen4 M.2 Topology Diagram
Suggested Toe and Heel Side Connection
Suggested Ground Void for Main Board M.2 Connector
PCIe Gen4 M.2 Topology Notes
NoteDetail
Add-in Card ConnectorConnector type: M.2 1. Each M.2 connector Vss pad should be connected to its own Vss via. The distance between the edge of the pad and the edge of the via pad should be 0.5mm max.
Add-in Card DevicePCIe Gen4 M.2 Spec compliant add-in card device.
AC cap valueRefer to Base Spec
Maximum via stub length for mainstream stackup250 um
Reference plane for microstrip routeMust be continuous ground.
Reference plane for stripline routeOne side can be power plane that has low frequency peak-to-peak noise, the other side must be continuous ground. Prefer ground on both sides.
Reference plane for dual stripline routeOne side can be power plane that has low frequency peak-to-peak noise, the other side must be continuous ground and it is the layer that is closer to the signal route. Prefer ground on both sides.
FiberweaveMust adhere to fiberweave related best routing practices (#406926).
Routing type for mainstream stackupPrefer non-interleaved routes in different layers.
Notes
NoteDetail
Backdrilled viaAllow for exit backdrill via of 250 um with 180 um entry stub.

(Internal) PCIe Gen4 Add-in Card Topology

PCIe Gen4 Add-in Card Topology Diagram
PCIe4 CEM Connector Sideband Optimization
PCIE Board Layout Recommendation Connector Voiding
PCIE Board Layout Recommendation Toe and Heel GND Via 1
PCIE Board Layout Recommendation Toe and Heel GND Via 2
PCIE Board Layout Recommendation SMT footprint Voiding Reference
PCIe Gen 4 CEM Connector Antipad Optimization
PCIe Board Layout Recommendation_ Toe Side HSIO Routing
(Internal) PCIe Gen4 Add-in Card Topology Notes
NoteDetail
Add-in card (M4 + M5)The total length of the add-in card (M4 + M5) is usually 38 mm to 50.4 mm. The M4 + M5 segment is a combination of MS/ SL/ DSL (MS where required to connect to surface mounted components). The M4 + M5 segment has a typical via count of 1. The total length matching RX-RX/TX-TX lane to lane (25mm max) include the budget within the module.
AC capacitor valueNominal 220 nF. (Spec range 176 nF to 265 nF including tolerance).
Maximum via stub length250 um
Reference plane for microstrip routeMust be continuous ground.
Reference plane for dual stripline routeOne side can be power plane that has low frequency peak-to-peak noise, the other side must be continuous ground and it is the layer that is closer to the signal route. Prefer ground on both sides.
Add-in card connector (CEM)Bottom entry to PCIe slot with no stub length (not counted in max vias allowed).
Routing type for mainstream stackupPrefer non-interleaved routes in different layers.
FiberweaveMust adhere to fiberweave related best routing practices (#406926).
Max Number of vias
Signal GroupMax Number of Vias AllowedNotes
Rx, Tx2PCIe Gen4 (not counting via under package)

Mainstream, Premium Mid Loss (PML), Rx,Tx

Category: Mainstream

Material: Premium Mid Loss (PML)

Signal Group: Rx, Tx

Redriver/Retimer: None

(Internal) PCIe Gen4 Add-in Card Topology Mainstream, Premium Mid Loss (PML), Rx,Tx Routing Guidelines
SegmentTline TypeMax Length Segment (mm)Max Length Segment Note
BOMS, DSL, SL12.7
M1 + M2MS, DSL, SLBO+M1+M2+M3 <= 127 mm
M3MS, DSL, SL8

Max Length Total (mm): 127

PCH PCIe Gen 5

PCIE5 Board Layout Recommendation AC Cap Voiding
PCH PCIe Gen 5 General Guidelines
NoteDetail
Voiding recommendation for mainstream stackupIt is recommended to void unused (non-functional) pads for differential vias and pin pads for ESDs, AC caps and connectors to optimize the impedance matching in the channel.
PCIe5 AC capacitor sizeIt is required to use 0201 . Void reference layer under pad size of differential cap together. Extend void by 38 um on all sides of pads. Reference example provided per figure. Ensure spacing between P and N cap is about 305 um and spacing between caps of different pair caps is more than 762 um.
Unused signalsUnused data signals should be left as no connect at the ball.
Interleaved requirementRefer to topology section for details.
Routing and return via requirement near vertical transitionFor all vertical transitions, the differential transmission line should be connected to the two vias symmetrically. Moreover, Vss return vias should be placed near the signal vias in an equidistant symmetrical manner, and all signal vias should have identical Vss return vias around each of them.
PTH connector voiding requirementDifferential Oval Anti Pad required for all layers. For PCIe5, see topology specific notes for additional guidance.
Voiding under CEM SMT connector padsRequired
Fiberweave for PCIe5Must adhere to fiberweave related best routing practices (#406926).
Recommendations and considerations for routing near switch mode power supply, routing under inductor, routing under phase node, and routing under DrMOSRefer to Technical White Paper Doc#:  726825
General Guidelines
NoteDetail
Backdrill for PCB PTHSignals can transition between any PCB layers as long as the maximum via / PTH stub length is < 250 um. Use backdrill to reduce stub length to meet < 250 um requirement.
PCH PCIe Gen 5 Length Matching
Matching Group IdMatching GroupsTotal/Within LayerLength/DelayRequiredMaximum Mismatch
1Pair (P-N)TotalLength (mm)Yes0.125
2Pair (P-N)WithinLength (mm)Yes0.125
3TX-TXTotalLength (mm)Yes25
4RX-RXTotalLength (mm)Yes25
5TX-RXTotalLength (mm)No0
6DATA-CLKTotalLength (mm)No0

PCIe Gen5 Device Down Topology

PCIe Gen5 Device Down Topology Diagram
PCIe Gen5 Device Down Topology Notes
NoteDetail
DevicePCIe Gen5 Spec compliant device.
AC cap valueRefer to Base Spec
Maximum via stub length250 um
Reference plane for microstrip routeMust be continuous ground.
Reference plane for stripline routeGround on both sides strongly preferred. If necessary, one side can be a power plane that has low amount of low frequency noise, but the other side must be continuous ground. Additional simulations might be required to quantify impact of dual referencing. Multiple split planes on reference layers is not recommended.
Reference plane for dual stripline routeGround on both sides strongly preferred. If necessary, one side can be a power plane that has low amount of low frequency noise, but the other side must be continuous ground. Additional simulations might be required to quantify impact of dual referencing. Multiple split planes on reference layers is not recommended.
FiberweaveMust adhere to fiberweave related best routing practices (#406926).
Max Number of vias
Signal GroupMax Number of Vias AllowedNotes
Rx, Tx4PCIe Gen5

Signal Group: Tx

Signal MRTS
Segment NameCategoryStartEnd
TXDevice01
BOTrace12
M1Trace23
CAPCapacitor34
M2Trace45
BITrace56
DeviceDevice6-1

Signal Group: Rx

Signal MRTS
Segment NameCategoryStartEnd
RXDevice01
BOTrace12
M1Trace23
CAPCapacitor34
M2Trace45
BITrace56

PCIe Gen5 M.2 Topology

PCIe Gen5 M.2 Topology Diagram
PCIe Gen5 M.2 Connector Voiding Recommendation
Suggested Toe and Heel Side Connection
PCIe Gen5 M.2 Topology Notes
NoteDetail
Add-in Card ConnectorConnector type: M.2 1. Each M.2 connector Vss pad should be connected to its own Vss via. The distance between the edge of the pad and the edge of the via pad should be 255 um max. 2. Toe-side routing only for SMT connector.
Add-in Card DevicePCIe Gen5 M.2 Spec compliant add-in card device.
AC cap valueRefer to Base Spec
Maximum via stub length for mainstream stackup250 um
Reference plane for microstrip routeMust be continuous ground.
Reference plane for dual stripline routeGround on both sides strongly preferred. If necessary, one side can be a power plane that has low amount of low frequency noise, but the other side must be continuous ground. Additional simulations might be required to quantify impact of dual referencing. Multiple split planes on reference layers is not recommended.
FiberweaveMust adhere to fiberweave related best routing practices (#406926).

PCIe Gen5 M.2 Topology Mainstream, Premium Mid Loss (PML), Rx,Tx Routing Guidelines
SegmentTline TypeMax Length Segment (mm)Max Length Segment Note

(internal) PCIe Gen5 Add-in Card Topology

PCIe Gen5 Add-in Card Topology Diagram
PCIE Board Layout Recommendation Connector Voiding
PCIE Board Layout Recommendation Toe and Heel GND Via 1
PCIE Board Layout Recommendation Toe and Heel GND Via 2
PCIE Board Layout Recommendation Toe Side HSIO Routing
PCIe Board Layout Recommendation_ SMT Footprint Voiding Reference
(internal) PCIe Gen5 Add-in Card Topology Notes
NoteDetail
Maximum via stub length250 um
Reference plane for microstrip routeMust be continuous ground.
Reference plane for stripline routeGround on both sides strongly preferred. If necessary, one side can be a power plane that has low amount of low frequency noise, but the other side must be continuous ground.
Reference plane for dual stripline routeGround on both sides strongly preferred. If necessary, one side can be a power plane that has low amount of low frequency noise, but the other side must be continuous ground and it is the layer that is closer to the signal route.
AC cap valueNominal 220 nF recommended (spec range 176 nF to 265 nF including tolerance.). Use 0201 component size.
Add-in card connector (CEM)Only SMT is supported.
FiberweaveMust adhere to fiberweave related best routing practices (#406926).
Connector requirementThis topology assumes connector insertion loss is < 0.52 dB, FEXT better than -44 dB and NEXT better than -44 dB up to Nyquist.
Max Number of vias
Signal GroupMax Number of Vias AllowedNotes
Rx, Tx2PCIe Gen5

Mainstream, Premium Mid Loss (PML), Rx,Tx

Category: Mainstream

Material: Premium Mid Loss (PML)

Signal Group: Rx, Tx

Redriver/Retimer: None

(internal) PCIe Gen5 Add-in Card Topology Mainstream, Premium Mid Loss (PML), Rx,Tx Routing Guidelines
SegmentTline TypeMax Length Segment (mm)Max Length Segment Note
BOMS, DSL, SL13
M1MS, DSL, SL127
M2MS, DSL, SL13

Max Length Total (mm): 127

(Internal) PCIe Gen5 M.2 Topology (Operating at Gen4 Data Rate)

PCIe Gen5 M.2 Topology (Operating at Gen4 Data Rate) Diagram
PCIe Gen5 M.2 Connector Voiding Recommendation
Suggested Toe and Heel Side Connection
(Internal) PCIe Gen5 M.2 Topology (Operating at Gen4 Data Rate) Notes
NoteDetail
Maximum via stub length for mainstream stackup250 um
Reference plane for microstrip routeMust be continuous ground.
Reference plane for dual stripline routeOne side can be power plane that has low frequency peak-to-peak noise, the other side must be continuous ground and it is the layer that is closer to the signal route. Prefer ground on both sides.
AC cap valueNominal 220 nF recommended (spec range 176 nF to 265 nF including tolerance).
Routing typeMain route routing must be interleaved.
M.2 connector1. Each M.2 connector Vss pad should be connected to its own Vss via. The distance between the edge of the pad and the edge of the via pad should be 255 um max. 2. Toe-side routing only for SMT connector.
Add-in cardAssuming ~50 mm of PCB routing and 2 vias with spec reference package. The total length matching RX-RX/TX-TX lane to lane (25mm max) include the budget within the module.
FiberweaveMust adhere to fiberweave related best routing practices (#406926).
Max Number of vias
Signal GroupMax Number of Vias Allowed
Rx, Tx2

Mainstream, Premium Mid Loss (PML), Rx,Tx

Category: Mainstream

Material: Premium Mid Loss (PML)

Signal Group: Rx, Tx

Redriver/Retimer: None

(Internal) PCIe Gen5 M.2 Topology (Operating at Gen4 Data Rate) Mainstream, Premium Mid Loss (PML), Rx,Tx Routing Guidelines
SegmentTline TypeMax Length Segment (mm)Max Length Segment Note
BOMS, DSL, SL13
M1MS, DSL, SL152
M2MS, DSL, SL13

Max Length Total (mm): 152

Max Length Total Note: Max length is BO+M1+M2

DMI Gen 5

DMI Gen 5 General Guidelines
NoteDetail
Reference plane(1) Continuous GND is recommended. (2) If continuous GND cannot be implemented, a combination of GND on one side and continuous power plane on the other side with the condition that the GND plane be the closer reference (dual-reference) can be implemented. The continuous power plane requires low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt). (3) If non-continuous power referencing is required on microstrip/ surface layer, signal can reference over power planes with a low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt), but stitching caps are required over each plane split and need to be placed within 6 mm of a signal running across the plane split.
Voiding recommendation for mainstream stackupIt is recommended to void unused (non-functional) pads reference plane for differential vias and pin pads for ESDs, AC caps and connectors to optimize the impedance matching in the channel.
Unused signalsUnused data signals should be left as no connect at the ball.
Routing and return via requirement near vertical transitionFor all vertical transitions, the differential transmission line should be connected to the two vias symmetrically. Moreover, Vss return vias should be placed near the signal vias in an equidistant symmetrical manner, and all signal vias should have identical Vss return vias around each of them.
FiberweaveMust adhere to fiberweave related best routing practices (#406926).
Recommendations and considerations for routing near switch mode power supply, routing under inductor, routing under phase node, and routing under DrMOSRefer to Technical White Paper Doc#:  726825
Reference plane for microstrip routeMust be continuous ground.
Reference plane for stripline routeGround on both sides strongly preferred. If necessary, only a single continuous power reference plane is permitted on one side, but the other side must be a continuous ground. Simulation is needed to ensure electrical requirements are met.
Reference plane for dual stripline routeGround on both sides strongly preferred. If necessary, only a single continuous power reference plane is permitted on one side, but the other side must be a continuous ground and it is the layer that is closer to the signal route. Simulation is needed to ensure electrical requirements are met.
DMI Gen 5 Length Matching
Matching Group IdMatching GroupsTotal/Within LayerLength/DelayRequiredMaximum Mismatch
1Pair (P-N)TotalLength (mm)Yes0.125
2Pair (P-N)WithinLength (mm)Yes0.25
3TX-TXTotalLength (mm)Yes25
4RX-RXTotalLength (mm)Yes25
5TX-RXTotalLength (mm)No0
6DATA-CLKTotalLength (mm)No0

CLK PCIe Gen 4 Add-In Card Clock Topology

PCIe Gen4 Add-in Card Clock Topology Diagram
Differential Clock Shielding
CLK PCIe Gen 4 Add-In Card Clock Topology Notes
NoteDetail
Signal isolationDifferential SRC Clocks supporting PCIe Gen4 devices require 0.76 mm isolation to adjacent high speed IOs. Isolation to other Differential Clocks, USB2 and low-speed IOs can be maintained at 0.5 mm.
Reference planeContinuous ground only.
EMC/ RF noise protection[1] For signal sections routed as microstrip on surface layer, a GND ring/ shield is advised to be added with sufficient GND stitching vias for the length of the microstrip trace. [2] GND ring/ shield stitching vias should be placed at regular intervals of 4 - 12 mm. [3] It is advised to route in inner layer as stripline/ dual stripline routing. Limit microstrip routing and follow above shielding guidelines.

Signal GroupMax Number of Vias AllowedVia Placement

CLK PCIe Gen 5 Add-In Card Clock Topology

PCIe Gen5 Add-in Card Clock Topology Diagram
Differential Clock Shielding
CLK PCIe Gen 5 Add-In Card Clock Topology Notes
NoteDetail
Signal isolationDifferential SRC Clocks supporting PCIe Gen5 devices require 0.76 mm isolation to adjacent high speed IOs. Isolation to other Differential Clocks, USB2 and low-speed IOs can be maintained at 0.5 mm.
Reference planeContinuous ground only
EMC/ RF noise protection[1] For signal sections routed as microstrip on surface layer, a GND ring/ shield is advised to be added with sufficient GND stitching vias for the length of the microstrip trace. [2] GND ring/ shield stitching vias should be placed at regular intervals of 4 - 12 mm. [3] It is advised to route in inner layer as stripline/ dual stripline routing. Limit microstrip routing and follow above shielding guidelines. [4] GND ring/ shield spacing to signal should be 3x-5x the dielectric height of the stackup or approximately 300 um (whichever is larger). Clock signal spacing to other signals should follow the signal isolation guidelines . [5] GND ring/ shield width should be 2x the dielectric height of the stackup or approximately 140 um (whichever is larger).
Max Number of vias
Signal GroupMax Number of Vias AllowedVia Placement
Tx4Total Channel

CLK PCIe Gen 5 Device Down Clock Topology

PCIe Gen5 Device Down Clock Topology Diagram
Differential Clock Shielding
CLK PCIe Gen 5 Device Down Clock Topology Notes
NoteDetail
Signal isolationDifferential SRC Clocks supporting PCIe Gen5 devices require 0.76 mm isolation to adjacent high speed IOs. Isolation to other Differential Clocks, USB2 and low-speed IOs can be maintained at 0.5 mm.
Reference planeContinuous ground only
EMC/ RF noise protection[1] For signal sections routed as microstrip on surface layer, a GND ring/ shield is advised to be added with sufficient GND stitching vias for the length of the microstrip trace. [2] GND ring/ shield stitching vias should be placed at regular intervals of 4 - 12 mm. [3] It is advised to route in inner layer as stripline/ dual stripline routing. Limit microstrip routing and follow above shielding guidelines. [4] GND ring/ shield spacing to signal should be 3x-5x the dielectric height of the stackup or approximately 300 um (whichever is larger). Clock signal spacing to other signals should follow the signal isolation guidelines . [5] GND ring/ shield width should be 2x the dielectric height of the stackup or approximately 140 um (whichever is larger).

Differential Clock (PCH-CPU Support)

Differential Clock (PCH-CPU Support) General Guidelines
NoteDetail
Applicable to PCH and CPU All guidelines are applicable to clock signals originating from both the PCH and the CPU.
Recommendations and considerations for routing near switch mode power supply, routing under inductor, routing under phase node, and routing under DrMOSRefer to Technical White Paper Doc#:  726825
Differential Clock (PCH-CPU Support) Length Matching
Matching Group IdMatching GroupsTotal/Within LayerLength/DelayRequiredMaximum Mismatch
1Pair (P-N)TotalLength (mm)Yes0.254
2Pair (P-N)WithinLength (mm)Yes0.254
3TX-TXTotalLength (mm)No0
4RX-RXTotalLength (mm)No0
5TX-RXTotalLength (mm)No0
6DATA-CLKTotalLength (mm)No0

(Internal) DMI RefCLK Topology

Description: Internal Debug Clocks

(Internal) DMI RefCLK Topology Diagram
(Internal) DMI RefCLK Topology Notes
NoteDetail
Max length / Min lengthThere is no max length, though a typical estimated length is about 203.2 mm (8"). Minimum length of channel is 101.6 mm (4") to mitigate channel overshoot.
Shunt resistor placementShunt resistors (on each DP/DN signal) should be placed as close as possible to the CPU (receiver point). The max placement should be no further than about 25 mm (1") from the CPU.
PCH associated signals PCIe_ExtRefClk (P/N) DMI_RefClk (P/N)
CPU associated signals PCIe5_RefClk_Ext [0] (P/N) PCIe5_RefClk_Ext [1] (P/N) PCIe5_RefClk_Ext [2] (P/N) USB4_RefClk_Ext (P/N)
Signal routing guidelinesFollow standard differential routing guidelines for impedance and spacing, similar to baseline differential clocks.

Mainstream, Premium Mid Loss (PML), Rx

Category: Mainstream

Material: Premium Mid Loss (PML)

Signal Group: Rx

Redriver/Retimer: None

(Internal) DMI RefCLK Topology Mainstream, Premium Mid Loss (PML), Rx Routing Guidelines
SegmentTline TypeMax Length Segment (mm)
BO+M1MS, DSL, SL25
M2MS, DSL, SL203

Max Length Total (mm): 203

Max Length Total Note: Max length is typical length, but there is no theoretical max length upper bound.

CPU DMI CLK to PCH Topology

CPU DMI CLK to PCH Topology Diagram
CPU DMI CLK to PCH Topology Notes
NoteDetail
CPU DMI CLK signal nameCLKOUT_SRC_P/N. Note: DMI CLK can be mapped to any CLKOUT_SRC.
PCH DMI CLK signal nameEXT_INJ_PHY P/N
Signal isolationClock signals require 0.76 mm isolation to adjacent high speed IOs. Isolation to other differential clocks, USB2 and low-speed IOs can be maintained at 0.5 mm.
EMC/ RF noise protection[1] For signal sections of the signals which are routed on MS (surface) layer, a GND ring/ shield is advised to be added (with similar guidelines following a standard GND ring/shield such as for XTAL) with sufficient GND stitching vias for the length of the MS routed layer. [2] GND ring/ shield GND stitching vias should be placed at regular intervals of 4 - 12 mm. [3] It is advised to route the clock signals in inner layer SL/ DSL routing. Limit MS routed section and follow above shielding guidelines.
Reference planeContinuous ground only.

Signal GroupMax Number of Vias Allowed

eDP

Description: Guidelines are same for eDP using DDI interface or TCP interface.

eDP General Guidelines
NoteDetail
Voiding recommendationIt is recommended to void unused (non-functional) pads for differential vias, and pin pads for CMCs, ESDs and connectors to optimize the impedance matching in the channel. Voiding of 0402 or smaller AC capacitors pads is not necessary.
eDP Length Matching
Matching Group IdMatching GroupsTotal/Within LayerLength/DelayRequiredMaximum Mismatch
1Pair (P-N)TotalLength (mm)Yes0.125
2Pair (P-N)WithinLength (mm)Yes0.25
3TX-TXTotalLength (mm)Yes25

eDP Auxiliary Main Link Topology

eDP Auxilary Main Link Topology Diagram
eDP Auxiliary Main Link Topology Notes
NoteDetail
Number of vias allowedNo explicit limit, use best known routing practices.
Transmission line referencingReference planes can be continuous ground or continuous power that have low frequency peak to peak noise. Ground referencing is preferred.
AC cap value75 nF to 200 nF including tolerance.
Cable assembly75 - 100 Ω including tolerance. Insertion loss ≥ -1.0 dB @ 1 MHz.

M1Trace23
M2Trace34

M3Trace56

eDP HBR3 MUX CTLE Topology

eDP HBR3 MUX CTLE Topology Diagram
eDP HBR3 MUX CTLE Topology Notes
NoteDetail
Reference plane for microstrip routeContinuous ground or continuous power that has low frequency peak to peak noise, ground preferred.
Reference plane for stripline and dual stripline routeBoth sides can either be continuous ground or continuous power that has low frequency peak to peak noise, ground preferred.
CMCFor recommended part numbers, please refer to the EMC Component Selection section. Optional. Populating will not reduce the supported length.
AC cap value75 nF to 265 nF including tolerance.
Mux component guidelinesUse a passive mux with the following parameters: Differential insertion loss @ 4.05 GHz > -2.2 dB Differential return loss @ 4.05 GHz < -8.0 dB Differential FEXT @ 4.05 GHz < -50 dB
355 mm cable assembly (micro coaxial)80-100 Ω including tolerance. 25 mm assembly insertion loss ≥ -0.62 dB. 355 mm assembly insertion loss ≥ -5.1 dB @ 4.05 GHz.
Twisted pair cable assemblyRefer to "ADL_TwistedPair_CableSpec_eDP_TWP_Rev0p7" Document 644925. This document describes the electrical parameter limits for the twisted pair cables assumed for this topology. It does not consider any EMI/RFI risks.
TCON RX equalizationCTLE only.
FiberweaveMust adhere to fiberweave related best routing practices (#406926).
eDP HBR2 max lengthRefer to eDP HBR3 MUX CTLE+DFE Topology recommendation for HBR2 max length.
Max Number of vias
Signal GroupMax Number of Vias AllowedVia Placement
Tx3Total Channel

Signal Group: Tx

Signal MRTS
Segment NameInstanceCategoryStartEnd
TXDevice01
BOTrace12
M1Trace23
M2Trace34
MUXDevice45
M3Trace56
AC CAPCapacitor67
M4Trace78
CMCDevice89
M5Trace910
eDP CONNECTOR1Device1011
eDP CableDevice1112
eDP CONNECTOR2Device12-1

eDP HBR3 MUX CTLE+DFE Topology

eDP HBR3 MUX CTLE+DFE Topology Diagram
eDP HBR3 MUX CTLE+DFE Topology Notes
NoteDetail
Reference plane for microstrip routeContinuous ground or continuous power that has low frequency peak to peak noise, ground preferred.
Reference plane for stripline and dual stripline routeBoth sides can either be continuous ground or continuous power that has low frequency peak to peak noise, ground preferred.
CMCFor recommended part numbers, please refer to the EMC Component Selection section. Optional. Populating will not reduce the supported length.
AC cap value75 nF to 265 nF including tolerance.
Mux component guidelinesUse a passive mux with the following parameters: Differential insertion loss @ 4.05 GHz > -2.2 dB Differential return loss @ 4.05 GHz < -8.0 dB Differential FEXT @ 4.05 GHz < -50 dB
355 mm cable assembly (micro coaxial)80-100 Ω including tolerance. 25 mm assembly insertion loss ≥ -0.62 dB. 355 mm assembly insertion loss ≥ -5.1 dB @ 4.05 GHz.
Twisted pair cable assemblyRefer to "ADL_TwistedPair_CableSpec_eDP_TWP_Rev0p7" document #644925. This document describes the electrical parameter limits for the twisted pair cables assumed for this topology. It does not consider any EMI/ RFI risks.
TCON RX equalizationCTLE + DFE.
FiberweaveMust adhere to fiberweave related best routing practices (#406926).
eDP HBR2 max lengthThis recommendation is applicable to eDP HBR2 Mux topology for panels comply to the VESA eDP HBR2 standard equalization.

eDP Hot Plug Detect Implementation

eDP Hot Plug Detect Implementation Diagram
eDP Hot Plug Detect Implementation Notes
NoteDetail
RoutingRecommend 45 Ω nominal trace impedance with reasonable noise isolation.
VCC1.25 V
R1100 kΩ ± 5%
R2100 kΩ ± 5%
Q1For panel implementing eDP HPD: BSS138p or equivalent (0.85 V < VGS threshold < 1.95 V, input capacitance < 1 nF) For panel implementing eDP LVHPD: RU1J002YN or equivalent (0.35 V < VGS < 0.8 V, input capacitance < 1 nF)
ConnectivityFollow the vendor data sheet for any additional HPD connectivity requirements.

eUSB2

eUSB2 General Guidelines
NoteDetail
USB 2.0 routing shall comply to USB 2.0 DCR ECN for D+ and D- maximum series DC resistance (DCR) specification.
Recommendations and considerations for routing near switch mode power supply, routing under inductor, routing under phase node, and routing under DrMOSRefer to Technical White Paper Doc#:  726825
eUSB2 Length Matching
Matching Group IdMatching GroupsTotal/Within LayerLength/DelayRequiredMaximum Mismatch
1Pair (P-N)TotalLength (mm)Yes0.381
2Pair (P-N)WithinLength (mm)Yes0.254
3TX-TXTotalLength (mm)No0
4RX-RXTotalLength (mm)No0
5TX-RXTotalLength (mm)No0
6DATA-CLKTotalLength (mm)No0

Reference planeContinuous GND recommended.

HDMI

HDMI General Guidelines
NoteDetail
Length matching between pair to pair (inter pair)Within 13 mm (HDMI 2.1); 25 mm (HDMI 1.4).
Voiding recommendationIt is recommended to void unused (non-functional) pads for differential vias and pin pads for CMCs, ESDs and connectors to optimize the impedance matching in the channel. Voiding of 0402 or smaller AC capacitors pads is not necessary.
Unused signalsUnused data and AUX signals should be left no connected at the BGA ball.
Routing and return via requirement near vertical transitionFor all vertical transitions, the differential transmission lines should be connected to the two vias symmetrically. Moreover, Vss return vias should be placed near the signal vias in an equidistant symmetrical manner and all signal vias should have identical Vss return vias around each of them.
Fiberweave notesMust adhere to fiberweave related best routing practices (#406926).
HDMI Length Matching
Matching Group IdMatching GroupsTotal/Within LayerLength/DelayRequiredMaximum Mismatch
1Pair (P-N)TotalLength (mm)Yes0.125
2Pair (P-N)WithinLength (mm)Yes0.25
3TX-TXTotalLength (mm)Yes13
4RX-RXTotalLength (mm)No0
5TX-RXTotalLength (mm)No0

HDMI Re-timer 12G Topology

HDMI Re-timer 12G Topology Diagram
HDMI Re-timer 12G Topology Notes
NoteDetail
Number of vias allowedMax 2 vias.
Maximum via stub length250 um per via.
Reference plane for microstrip routeContinuous ground or continuous power that has low frequency peak to peak noise, ground preferred.
Reference plane for stripline and dual stripline routeBoth sides can either be continuous ground or continuous power that has low frequency peak to peak noise, ground preferred.
CMCOptional. For recommended part numbers, please refer to the EMC Component Selection section. Populating will not reduce the supported length.
ESDFor recommended part numbers, please refer to the EMC Component Selection section. Optional if Retimer has integrated ESD that meets discharge requirements.
AC cap value85 nF to 200 nF including tolerances.
Re-timerRe-timer Rx must be spec compliable for HDMI 2.1a FRL source requirements at TP2_EQ
Max supported HDMI 1.4b TMDS data rate3.4 Gbps
Max supported HDMI 2.1 TMDS data rate6.0 Gbps
Max supported HDMI 2.1 FRL data rate12 Gbps
Retimer sideband communicationAny port configured to support HDMI must implement sideband communications via the DDC (I2C) channel associated with that HDMI port as defined in the Video BIOS Table (VBT).
ConnectorConnector shall meet all Category 3 requirements defined by the HDMI1.4b spec (Pin assignment, contact sequence, mechanical performance, electrical performance, environmental characteristics, connector drawings) in addition to the electrical performance requirements listed in HDMI2.1 spec which are defined by compliance parametric electrical tests HFR6-1 (Mated Connector Differential Impedance), HFR6-2 (Mated Connector Attenuation - Differential Insertion Loss) and HFR6-3 (Mated Connector Attenuation to Far-End Crosstalk Ratio) and must be included within the “Approved Category 3 Connector list” defined by the HDMI Licensing Administrator Inc.
Routing styleTo reduce system RFI/ EMI, it is recommended to use SL instead of MS. If MS routing is needed, refer to EMC PDG for RFI/ EMI mitigation.

Signal GroupMax Number of Vias AllowedVia Placement

HDMI Limiting Redriver 12G Topology

HDMI Limiting Redriver 12G Topology Diagram
HDMI Limiting Redriver 12G Topology Notes
NoteDetail
Maximum via stub length250um per via
Reference plane for microstrip routeContinuous ground or continuous power that has low frequency peak to peak noise, ground preferred.
Reference plane for stripline and dual stripline routeBoth sides can either be continuous ground or continuous power that has low frequency peak to peak noise, ground preferred.
CMCRefer Electromagnetic Compatibility Chapter (Common Mode Choke Selection) for more details. Populating will not reduce the supported length.
ESDConsult with the redriver vendor to determine the appropriate ESD recommendation. Optional: If Redriver has integrated ESD that meets discharge requirements.
AC cap value85 nF to 200 nF including tolerances.
Limiting RedriverRedriver must be HDMI 2.1a FRL spec compliant. Redriver part and equalization setting should be selected accordingly to compensate pre-channel losses. Refer to the redriver datasheet for detailed information on EQ settings and performance characteristics to achieve the best results. The exact pre-channel differential insertion loss for a given port with a specific routing and stackup can have a different maximum routing length limit. These recommendations are intended to ensure designs will have sufficient RX EQ to accommodate the expected worst-case loss.
Max supported HDMI 1.4b TMDS data rate3.4 Gbps
Max supported HDMI 2.1 TMDS data rate6.0 Gbps
Max supported HDMI 2.1 FRL data rate12 Gbps
Retimer sideband communicationAny port configured to support HDMI must implement sideband communications via the DDC (I2C) channel associated with that HDMI port as defined in the Video BIOS Table (VBT).
ConnectorConnector shall meet all Category 3 requirements defined by the HDMI1.4b spec (Pin assignment, contact sequence, mechanical performance, electrical performance, environmental characteristics, connector drawings) in addition to the electrical performance requirements listed in HDMI2.1 spec which are defined by compliance parametric electrical tests HFR6-1 (Mated Connector Differential Impedance), HFR6-2 (Mated Connector Attenuation - Differential Insertion Loss) and HFR6-3 (Mated Connector Attenuation to Far-End Crosstalk Ratio) and must be included within the “Approved Category 3 Connector list” defined by the HDMI Licensing Administrator Inc.
Max Number of vias
Signal GroupMax Number of Vias AllowedVia Placement

HDMI Hot Plug Detect Implementation

HDMI Hot Plug Detect Implementation Diagram
HDMI Hot Plug Detect Implementation Notes
NoteDetail
RoutingRecommend 45 Ω nominal trace impedance with reasonable noise isolation.
VCC1.8 V
R1100 kΩ ±5%
R2100 kΩ ±5%
Q1BSS138p or equivalent, 0.85 V < VGS threshold < 1.95 V, input capacitance < 1 nF.
ConnectivityEnsure to follow the vendor data sheet for any additional HPD connectivity requirements.
ESDOptional, 5 V tolerant.

HDMI DDC Topology

HDMI DDC Direct Connect Topology Diagram
HDMI DDC Buffered Topology Diagram
HDMI DDC Topology Notes
NoteDetail
RoutingTotal length from driver to HDMI connector is limited by spec capacitance limit of 50 pF including trace capacitance and discrete. Please refer to I2C section for calculation details.
Power railsPower rails which will turn off in S3-S5 sleep states.
VCC-A1.8 V
VCC-B5 V
VCC-C3.3 V
U1 I2C Voltage Level Translator, TCA9509 or equivalent.
R1 resistor10 kΩ ± 5%
R2 resistor1.5 kΩ ± 5%
Back drive current protectionMax capacitance for back drive current protection Schottky diode is 10 pF. Must use diode of Schottky type to minimize voltage drop.
I2C guidanceDDC signals follow I2C guidelines.
Alternative implementations Depending on the Active Level Shifter implemented the DDC implementation may vary. Please refer to the vendors requirements for any changes in implementation.
Active level shifter partFollow Active Level Shifter datasheet recommendation as SDA/SCL signals may be optional depending on the part requirements. Component may be removed from the topology diagram if SDA/SCL connections are not required.
ESDFor recommended part numbers, please refer to the EMC Component Selection section.
Cs cap value47 pF nominal.
Edge rate controlAn edge rate reduction mechanism such as a 47 pF capacitor (Cs) terminated to VSS is recommended to comply with DisplayPort maximum Aux slew rate specification .

CPU USB 3.2 Gen 1

Description: This PHY only supports configuration with standard Type-A connector.

USB 3.2 Stub Requirement
USB 3.2 Component Routing Requirement
USB 3.2 Component Pad Voiding Requirement
USB 3.2 Receptacle Ground Void Dimension Recommendations
USB 3.2 Signals to PTH Transition Requirement
CPU USB 3.2 Gen 1 General Guidelines
NoteDetail
Length matching between P and N within a diff. pairWithin same layer mismatch < 0.254 mm. Total length mismatch < 0.127 mm.
Stub requirementChannel and via stub requirement must meet < 381 um for both Tx and Rx signal pairs.
Tx AC cap value for USB 3.2 Gen 1 & Gen 2AC capacitor value: 100 nF nominal (75 nF - 265 nF range).
Short circuit protection for Type-C topology (if applicable)Crx cap value: 297 nF to 363 nF including tolerance, 25 V. Rb resistor value: 220 kΩ ± 5%.
Component size requirement ( CMC, ESD, AC cap, Resistor)Strongly recommended to use 0201 components for better impedance control.
Component voidingAll component pads must be voided on L2 and with GND reference on L3. Suggest having pad voiding size of 50.8 um overcut. Refer to Component Pad Voiding diagram.
Component routingSignal pair to entry/ exist from components pad symmetrically. Maintain differential routing to meet trace target impedance whenever possible.
Signal PTH/ via transitionDifferential pair voiding needed for each signal pair transition with recommended antipad size of 0.75 mm. Suggest having two symmetrical GND stitching vias for each signal pair transition.
Cable and connector recommendationStrongly recommended to use SMT connectors. For PTH connectors (assuming connector is on the top), USB3.2 signals need to be routed from the bottom of the board such that there is no stub on for connector entry. Intel strongly recommends selecting cables and connectors which meet electrical requirements specified in both USB-IF Cable and Connector Specification dated June 2017 and Universal Serial Bus 3.1 Legacy Connectors and Cable Assemblies Compliance dated April 2018. The USB-IF does not certify legacy or USB Type-C(tm) Gen2 stacked connectors. The USB-IF does certify legacy or USB Type-C(tm) Gen1 stacked connectors. Refer USB-IF for more details.
PTH connector voiding requirementDifferential oval antipad required for all layers. Suggest using differential signal antipad with 2 mm size.
Repeater pad voidingA differential void on L2 that is larger than the repeater with 50.8 um overcut is recommended. GND referencing is needed on L3. Refer to Component Pad Voiding diagram.
Routing schemeNon-interleaved breakout (B0) is required to mitigate near-end crosstalk. The main route (MR) supports both interleaved routing and non-interleaved routing for maximum flexibility on stripline (SL). For microstrip (MS), interleaved routing scheme is recommended.
Reference planeContinuous GND is recommended. If continuous GND cannot be implemented, a combination of GND on one side and continuous power plane on the other side with the condition that the GND plane be the closer reference (dual-reference) can be implemented. The continuous power plane requires low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt). If non-continuous power referencing is unavoidable on microstrip/ surface layer, signal can reference over power planes with a low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt), but stitching caps are required over each plane split and need to be placed within 6 mm of a signal running across the plane split.
CPU USB 3.2 Gen 1 Length Matching
Matching Group IdMatching GroupsTotal/Within LayerLength/DelayRequiredMaximum Mismatch
1Pair (P-N)TotalLength (mm)Yes0.127
2Pair (P-N)WithinLength (mm)Yes0.254
3TX-TXTotalLength (mm)No0
4RX-RXTotalLength (mm)No0
5TX-RXTotalLength (mm)No0
6DATA-CLKTotalLength (mm)No0
